pull.title: Checks for null data transaction before issuing error to debug.log
pull.body:
`CWalletTx::GetAmounts` could not find output address for null data transactions, thus issuing an error in debug.log. This change checks to see if the transaction is `OP_RETURN` before issuing error.

resolves #6142

events.message:
checks for null data transaction before debug.log

CWalletTx::GetAmounts could not find output address for null data transactions, thus issuing an error in debug.log. This change checks to see if the transaction is OP_RETURN before issuing error.

resolves #6142
wallet: check if tx scriptPubKey is unspendable

issue.title: Checks for null data transaction (OP_Return) before issuing error to debug.log
issue.body:
Description: 
CWalletTx::GetAmounts could not find output address for null data transactions, thus issuing an error in debug.log. This change checks to see if the transaction is OP_RETURN before issuing error.
Fixes [bitcoin issue 6142](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6142).

Source: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7200
Commit 1: https://github.com/accraze/bitcoin/commit/b6915b82398d2e1d1f888b3816adfaf06d9a450e
Commit 2: https://github.com/accraze/bitcoin/commit/c611acc38a95d336a824b632823aa1b652e570df
Commit 3: https://github.com/accraze/bitcoin/commit/d812daf967ba4173bfa1c37eeb4ab7a0ccc4df25

Gridcoin code locations: (Unsure which of the two locations should have this change, very similar code chunks)
https://github.com/gridcoin/Gridcoin-Research/blob/master/src/wallet.cpp#L910
https://github.com/gridcoin/Gridcoin-Research/blob/master/src/wallet.cpp#L831

TL;DR:
The following code snippet:
`if (!ExtractDestination(txout.scriptPubKey, address))`
Changes to:
`if (!ExtractDestination(txout.scriptPubKey, address) && !txout.scriptPubKey.IsUnspendable())`
Justification:
OP_Return transactions are null data transactions & currently (potentially) create an error in the debug.log file. Fixing this will compliment OP_Return functionality within the Gridcoin client.

comments.body: Instead of checking `txout.scriptPubKey[0]` you should probably use `CScript::IsUnspendable()`.
